pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:0.5.eng: 33. The training rule on in order

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ omasitvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate almsfood picking here and there. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will eat almsfood in order,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.4.eng: Almsfood is to be eaten in order.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ omasitvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood picking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.11.eng: if he picks things out to give to others;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.12.eng: if he picks things out to put it into someone else’s vessel;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.13.eng: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.13.comm: According to Vin-vn-ṭ 1907 uttaribhaṅga is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called sūpa. However, since uttaribhaṅga is a rare word, the basic meaning of which is something like “further condiments”, it is quite possible that it is here meant to include all foods apart from bean curries.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.16.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.17.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:0.5.eng: 34. The training rule on the right proportion of bean curry

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjantā sūpaññeva bahuṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood with large amounts of bean curry. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will eat almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.3.1.comm: According to Sp 2.604 this means the bean curries should make up one quarter of the rice: Samasūpako nāma yattha bhattassa catutthabhāgappamāṇo sūpo hoti, “Wherever the bean curry is one quarter of the rice is called samasūpaka.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.5.eng: there are two kinds of bean curry, to be taken with the hand:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.7.eng: Almsfood should be eaten with the right proportion of bean curry.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.8.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sūpaññeva bahuṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.8.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.14.eng: if it is any food apart from bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.14.comm: According to Kkh this means any curries apart from bean curry: Ṭhapetvā pana sūpaṁ avasesā sabbā pi sūpeyyabyañjanavikati rasaraso nāma hoti, “But apart from bean curry, all kinds of curry are called rasarasa.” My translation, however, is based on the fact that all other foods too are excluded.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.16.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.17.eng: if it is by means of his own property;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.20.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.21.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:0.5.eng: 35. The training rule on making a heap

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate their almsfood after making a heap. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.3.1.pli: “Na thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat almsfood after making a heap,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.4.eng: Almsfood should not be eaten after making a heap.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood after making heap, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.11.pli: parittake sese ekato saṅkaḍḍhitvā omadditvā bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.11.eng: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.15.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:0.5.eng: 36. The training rule on covering with rice

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sūpampi byañjanampi odanena paṭicchādenti bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāya …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their curries with rice because they wanted more. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.3.1.pli: “Na sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādessāmi bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāyāti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not cover my curries with rice because I want more,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.3.1.comm: Sūpa is defined at Bu Sk 29:1.4.1 as bean curry. Byañjana is explained at Khuddasikkhā-abhinavaṭīkā 61 as macchamaṁsādibyañjanañca, “And byañjana of fish, meat, etc.” So byañjana seems to refer to fine curries, whereas sūpa is more ordinary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.4.pli: Na sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādetabbaṃ bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.4.eng: One should not cover one’s curries with rice because one wants more.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādeti bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his curries with rice because he wants more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.10.eng: if the owners cover it and then give;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.11.eng: if it is not out of a desire for more;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.15.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:0.5.eng: 37. The training rule on requesting rice and bean curry

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate rice and bean curry that they had requested themselves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics eat rice and bean curry that they have requested themselves?

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.7.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.8.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.9.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.13.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.16.1.pli: “Na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.16.1.eng: ‘“I will not request bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks were sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.2.eng: The monks who were looking after them asked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.3.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up? I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.4.pli: “Pubbe mayaṃ, āvuso, sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjāma, tena no phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.4.eng: “Previously we ate rice and bean curry that we had requested ourselves, and then we were comfortable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.6.pli: ‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti kukkuccāyantā na viññāpema, tena no na phāsu hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.6.eng: that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.7.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.8.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā sūpampi odanampi attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.8.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat rice and bean curry that he has requested for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.9.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.9.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.10.1.pli: “Na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.10.1.eng: ‘“When not sick, I will not request bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.11.pli: Na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilānena attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.11.eng: When one is not sick, one should not request bean curry or rice for oneself and then eat it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.12.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.12.eng: If a monk who is not sick, out of disrespect, eats bean curry or rice that he has requested for himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.19.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.20.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.21.eng: if it is by means of his own property;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.24.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.25.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:0.5.eng: 38. The training rule on finding fault

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ujjhānasaññī paresaṃ pattaṃ olokenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking at the bowls of others finding fault. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.3.1.pli: “Na ujjhānasaññī paresaṃ pattaṃ olokessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not look at another’s almsbowl finding fault,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.4.eng: One should not look at the bowl of another finding fault.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ujjhānasaññī paresaṃ pattaṃ oloketi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, looks at the bowl of another finding fault, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.4.eng: if he looks with the intention of giving or having someone give;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.5.eng: if he is not finding fault;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.10.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mahantaṃ kabaḷaṃ karonti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were making large mouthfuls. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not make mouthfuls that are too large,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.4.eng: One should not make mouthfuls that are too large.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca mahantaṃ kabaḷaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a large mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.11.eng: if it is a fresh food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.11.comm: According to Sp 2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.12.eng: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.12.comm: For phalāphale see PED, sv. ā⁴.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13.eng: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13.comm: According to Vin-vn-ṭ 1907 uttaribhaṅga is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called sūpa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.16.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.17.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.4.eng: The subchapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.5.eng: 4. The second training rule on well-covered

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six did not cover their bodies while sitting in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will be well-covered while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.4.eng: One should be well-covered while sitting in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, does not cover his body while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.5.comm: Sp 2.578: Kāyaṁ vivaritvāti jattumpi urampi vivaritvā, “Does not cover his body means shoulder or chest uncovered.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.11.eng: if he has entered his dwelling;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.15.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dīghaṃ ālopaṃ karonti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were making elongated mouthfuls. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will make rounded mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca dīghaṃ ālopaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes an elongated mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.11.eng: if it is a fresh food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.11.comm: According to Sp 2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.12.eng: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.12.comm: For phalāphale see PED, sv. ā⁴.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.13.eng: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.13.comm: According to Vin-vn-ṭ 1907 uttaribhaṅga is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean curries, which are called sūpa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.16.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.17.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.18.eng: The fourth subchapter on respectfully is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:0.5.eng: 41. The training rule on without bringing

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū anāhaṭe kabaḷe mukhadvāraṃ vivaranti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six opened their mouths without bringing a mouthful to it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.3.1.pli: “Na anāhaṭe kabaḷe mukhadvāraṃ vivarissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not open my mouth without bringing a mouthful to it,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.4.eng: One should not open one’s mouth without bringing a mouthful to it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca anāhaṭe kabaḷe mukhadvāraṃ vivarati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, opens his mouth without bringing a mouthful to it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.9.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:0.5.eng: 42. The second training rule on without bringing

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhuñjamānā sabbaṃ hatthaṃ mukhe pakkhipanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six put their whole hand in their mouths while eating. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3.1.pli: “Na bhuñjamāno sabbaṃ hatthaṃ mukhe pakkhipissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not put my whole hand in my mouth while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3.1.comm: According to the sub-commentary, Sp-yoj 2.618, the whole hand refers to the five fingers: pañcaṅguliṁ sandhāya vuttaṁ, “It is said with regard to the five fingers.” The same point is made at Kkh-pṭ: Sakalaṁ hatthanti sakalā aṅguliyo, “The whole hand means all the fingers.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.4.pli: Na bhuñjamānena sabbo hattho mukhe pakkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.4.eng: One should not put one’s whole hand in one’s mouth while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca bhuñjamāno sabbaṃ hatthaṃ mukhe pakkhipati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, puts his whole hand in his mouth while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.9.eng: The second training rule is finished.
